diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Primary cutaneous gamma–delta T-cell lymphoma that triggered hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis syndrome
differential_diagnosis: DRESS (drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms) syndrome
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient meets six of the eight criteria for HLH and has a markedly elevated ferritin level leading to the consideration of HLH syndrome. Other potential triggers, including hematologic cancer, were ruled out through negative imaging and biopsy results. The combination of the patient's skin lesions, HLH symptoms, and specific immunophenotype favored a diagnosis of primary cutaneous gamma–delta T-cell lymphoma manifesting with HLH.
